FOF Process¶

Function to perform correlations.

fof_process.calc_all_stellarprops(filename, snapnum, newstars, group='Stars', SFR=True, r200=True)[source]¶

Routine to do everything :param group: which group to use for halos. Stars = at least 100 star particles, gas = at least 100 gas cells, DM = at least 300 DM particles.

Default: “Stars” Options: “Stars”, “Gas”, “DM”

Parameters:

  • SFR (bool) – whether or not to calculate the new stars Default: True

  • r200 (bool) – whether or not to calculate material inside r200

fof_process.find_newStars(objs, newstars, snapnum)[source]¶

Compare IDs in each object to the new stars and see which stars are new :param objs: dictionary containing the star IDs and stellar mass of each group :type objs: dict :param newstars: dictionary containing the new stars in each snap :type newstars: dict :param snapnum: HDF5 snap number :type snapnum: float, str, or int

Returns:

dictionary containing the stellar mass, particle IDs, and new stellar mass of each object

Return type:

dict

fof_process.get_DM(cat, boxsize, halo100_indices, massDMParticle, allStarIDs, allStarPositions, startAllStars, endAllStars, r200=True)[source]¶

Find all the DM particles in each object within r200 and sums to give the mass SORRY THAT EVERYTHING SAYS STARS :param cat: :param boxsize: :param halo100_indices: :param r200: whether or not to check whether particles lie inside r200 or not :type r200: bool

Returns:

dictionary containing DM IDs in each group and DM Mass

Return type:

(dict)

fof_process.get_DMIDgroups(cat, halo100_indices)[source]¶

given a list of indices, return the beginning and end of the grourp in gas indices

Get particle IDs (groupordered snap)

fof_process.get_Halos(cat)[source]¶

halos of greater than 300 particles AND nonzero virial radius

fof_process.get_cosmo_props(f)[source]¶

Create dictionary of cosmological parameters based on snapfile header.

fof_process.get_headerprops(f)[source]¶

” extract header properties from hdf5file Parameters: f (snap): snap Hdf5 file with header Returns: (list): boxsize, redshift, massDMParticle

fof_process.get_obj_properties(cat, boxsize, halo100_indices, allStarIDs, allStarMasses, allStarPositions, startAllStars, endAllStars, r200=True, Gas=False)[source]¶

Find all the star particles in each object within r200 and sums to give the mass :param cat: :param boxsize: :param halo100_indices: :param r200: whether or not to check whether particles lie inside r200 or not :type r200: bool :param Gas:

function can also be used for gas. If True, adds “gasMass” and “gasIndices” to dict instead of star keys.

Make sure to use gas positions, indices, etc as inputs instead.

Default: False

Returns:

dictionary containing star IDs in each group and stellar Mass

Return type:

(dict)

fof_process.get_starIDgroups(cat, halo100_indices)[source]¶

fof_process.open_hdf5(gofilename, foffilename)[source]¶

Opens hdf5 files with h5py given paths as defined in set_snap_directories

Parameters:

gofilename (str) – directory of snap-groupordered file goffilename (str): directory of fof table file

Returns: (tuple): snap-groupordered hdf5, fof table hdf5

fof_process.set_snap_directories(filename, snapnum, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets paths HDF5 from directory

Arguments: filename (str): directory of snap-groupordered file

snapnum (float): Snap file number foffilename (str, Optional): path to directory containing fof_subhalo_tab file.

Default: same directory as snap-groupordered

Returns: (tuple): path to groupordered file, path to fof file
